amendment.description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to repeal limits on how much individuals and political action committees may contribute to candidates or parties; repeal limits on how much parties can contribute to candidates; terminate taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns; require political parties to distinguish between federal and non-federal funds; require each state party to file with the FEC a copy of the same disclosure form as filed with the state; and institute certain electronic reporting requirements.
amendment.purpose: An amendment no. 11 printed in H.Rept. 106-311 to repeal limits on federal election campaign contributions and taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns; require political parties to distinguish between Federal and non Federal funds; and mandate electronic filing of reports.

action.text: Amendment (A011) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Doolittle.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Doolittle amendment (A011) Failed by recorded vote: 117 - 306 (Roll no. 419).
